abstract.text: Creates an expression that invokes one of the predefined functions.
Creates an expression that returns the result of invoking a selector with a specified name using specified arguments.
Creates an expression that invokes one of the predefined functions.

seeAlsoSections.title: Creating an Expression for a Function

inlineContent.text: The name of the function to invoke.
objects that will be used as parameters during the invocation of selector.
For a selector taking no parameters, the array should be empty. For a selector taking one or more parameters, the array should contain one
object which will evaluate to an instance of the appropriate type for each parameter.
If there is a mismatch between the number of parameters expected and the number you provide during evaluation, an exception may be raised or missing parameters may simply be replaced by
(which occurs depends on how many parameters are provided, and whether you have over- or underflow).
A new expression that invokes the function
parameter can be one of the following predefined functions.
object (the average of values in the array)
object (the sum of values in the array)
object (the number of elements in the array)
object (the minimum of the values in the array)
object (the maximum of the values in the array)
object (the median of the values in the array)
object (the mode of the values in the array)
object (the standard deviation of the values in the array)
object (the sum of the values in the array)
object (the result of subtracting the second value in the array from the first value in the array)
object (the result of multiplying the values in the array)
object (the result of dividing the first value in the array by the second value in the array)
object (the remainder of dividing the first value in the array by the second value in the array)
object (the square root of the value in the array)
object (the log of the value in the array)
object (the natural log of the value in the array)
object (the result of raising the first value in the array to the power of the second value in the array)
object (the base-e exponential of the value in the array)
object (the smallest integral value not less than the value in the array)
object (the absolute value of the value in the array)
object (the integral value nearest to but no greater than the value in the array)
and the value in the array (exclusive))

The result of evaluating the parameter as though the
This method raises an exception immediately if the selector is invalid; it raises an exception at runtime if the parameters are incorrect.
argument is a collection containing an expression which evaluates to a collection, as illustrated in the following examples:

code: id result = [expression expressionValueWithObject: nil context: nil];
BOOL ok = [result isEqual: [NSNumber numberWithInt: 60]]; // ok == YES

inlineContent.text: This method throws an exception immediately if the selector is unknown; it throws at runtime if the parameters are incorrect.
